availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Spencer County, Kentucky, farmer. Jessamine County, Kentucky, native. Married Hannah Van Buskirk Cochran. Father of John Cochran, Robert Cochran, Ann M. Cochran, Sarah Cochran, and Hannah Cochran. Moved to Spencer County in 1808. Farmer in Spencer County in 1850. Owned twenty-one enslaved people in Spencer County in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Spencer County, Spencer, p. 105; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Spencer County, Division No. 2, p. 15; Josiah Stoddard Johnston, Memorial History of Louisville from its First Settlement of the Year 1896 Vol 1 (Louisville: American Biographical Publishing Company, 1896), 444.
